Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Panusin (beta defensins; natural AMPs; crustaceans, arthropods, invertebrates, animals; XXA; UCSS1a)

Literature Information.Literature: APD analysis reveals that the sequence of THE PEPTIDE shows 40.9% sequence similarity toBovine beta-defensin 13. Predicted to be a beta defensin.Activity: Active against E. coli, K. pneumonia, S. aureus,  B. subtilis, and C. albicans.Antimicrobial robustness: Salt-resistant (salt-insensitive). UPdate 10/2022 B. subtilis name corrected by A.P.D.
Literature Information.Author: Montero-Alejo V, Corzo G, Porro-Suardíaz J, Pardo-Ruiz Z, Perera E, Rodríguez-Viera L, Sánchez-Díaz G, Hernández-Rodríguez EW, Álvarez C, Peigneur S, Tytgat J, Perdomo-Morales R.2016
Literature Information.Title: Panusin represents a new family of beta-defensin-like peptides in invertebrates.
